event.title: the 1920s and 30's when prospective gold diggers arrived

data.event: Wau was the site of a Gold rush during the 1920s and 30's when prospective gold diggers arrived at the coast at Salamaua and struggled inland along the Black Cat Track.

event.title: January 1943, during World War II, the Australian Army stopped

data.event: At the Battle of Wau, in January 1943, during World War II, the Australian Army stopped an advance by the Japanese.

event.title: was made at Koranga Creek by William ‘Shark-Eye’ Park, probably towards the end of 1921

data.event: The first strike at Wau, the start of what would be known as the Morobe Goldfield, was made at Koranga Creek by William ‘Shark-Eye’ Park, probably towards the end of 1921.

event.title: ran a clandestine mining operation for twelve months

data.event: Park and his partner, Jack Nettleton, ran a clandestine mining operation for twelve months from April 1922 until a new Mining Ordinance enabled them to get their gold out legally.

event.title: April 1922 until a new Mining Ordinance enabled

data.event: Park and his partner, Jack Nettleton, ran a clandestine mining operation for twelve months from April 1922 until a new Mining Ordinance enabled them to get their gold out legally.

event.title: took out 6000 troy ounces, or about 190 kg, of gold in August 1923

data.event: Nettleton, it is known, took out 6000 troy ounces, or about 190 kg, of gold in August 1923.
